jodd.madvoc.macro

Interface PathMacros

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasePathMacros, RegExpPathMacros, WildcardPathMacros

    public interface PathMacros
    Action path macros.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] extract(java.lang.String actionPath)
      Extracts array of macro values for matched action path for each name.
      boolean init(java.lang.String actionPath, java.lang.String[] separators)
      Initializes PathMacro and returns true if macros are found in the action path.
      int macrosCount()
      Returns macros count.
      int match(java.lang.String actionPath)
      Match provided action path with the path macros, Returns the number of matched non-macro characters.
      java.lang.String[] names()
      Returns names of all macros.
      java.lang.String[] patterns()
      Returns all patterns.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init(java.lang.String actionPath,
             java.lang.String[] separators)
        Initializes PathMacro and returns true if macros are found in the action path. Otherwise, returns false and the instance can be thrown away.

        Separators is array of 3 strings that defines: start, dividing string, and end of a macro.

      • names

        java.lang.String[] names()
        Returns names of all macros.

      • patterns

        java.lang.String[] patterns()
        Returns all patterns. Some elements may be null if some macro does not define a pattern.

      • macrosCount

        int macrosCount()
        Returns macros count.

      • match

        int match(java.lang.String actionPath)
        Match provided action path with the path macros, Returns the number of matched non-macro characters. Returns -1 if action path is not matched.

      • extract

        java.lang.String[] extract(java.lang.String actionPath)
        Extracts array of macro values for matched action path for each name. It is assumed that path macro was previously init(String, String[]) initialized} on this action path, i.e. input is not validated.

        Returned array string of macro values may contain null on all ignored macros.
